activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damont Lashawn Peacock

defendant.name: Peacock, Damont Lashawn
defendant.address: 4216 S County Road D, Janesville, WI 53548

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:17 PM Defendant Damont Lashawn Peacock appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Damont Lashawn Peacock.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Shaun Mahaffey sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:39 PM Defendant Damont Lashawn Peacock appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Damont Lashawn Peacock.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $3,000.00 with conditions: Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom and scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 1PM.
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
